title: Fraktales Systemmodell (FSM) Version 7.0
description: A machine-readable schema for the Fractal System Model elements and dynamic forces.

E1.name: Core Components
E1.operational_question: Are the core resources intact and available?

E2.name: Flow & Exchange
E2.description: Movement and exchange between system parts.
E2.operational_question: Where is the flow blocked or restricted?

E3.name: Agents
E3.operational_question: Who has agency? How is it calibrated?

E4.name: Embedded System
E4.description: The larger system in which the system is embedded.
E4.operational_question: What larger system influences this one?

E5.name: Potential / Source
E5.description: Potential, driving difference, cause of movement.
E5.operational_question: Where is potential lost or blocked?

E6.name: Rules & Principles
E6.description: Laws, principles & rules of the game.
E6.operational_question: Which rule is being broken or is too rigid?

E8.name: Chaos / Ground
E8.description: Primordial ground state, raw material for reorganization.
E8.operational_question: What new patterns are emerging from the chaos?

D1.name: Resistance
D1.description: Force that opposes motion and dissipates energy (friction).

D2.name: Coriolis Effect
D2.description: Apparent force that deflects motion in rotating systems.

D3.name: Centrifugal Force
D3.description: Apparent force that pushes outward from the center of rotation.

D4.name: Centripetal Force
D4.description: The real force that pulls toward the center of rotation.

D6.name: Meta-Reflection
D6.description: Cognitive monitoring instance that controls thought processes.
